Enum Piece

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<Piece>
com.github.bhlangonijr.chesslib.Piece
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Piece>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum Piece extends Enum<Piece>
A chess piece on the board, that is, a specific combination of a Side and a PieceType.

Each value defines a single piece, except for the special value NONE which identifies that no piece is selected or assigned.

    • fromValue

      public static Piece fromValue(String v)
      Returns a piece given its name.

      Same as invoking valueOf(String).

      Parameters:
      v - name of the piece
      Returns:
      the piece with the specified name
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name does not correspond to any piece

    • make

      public static Piece make(Side side, PieceType type)
      Returns the piece corresponding to the provided pair of side and type. If PieceType.NONE is requested, NONE is returned regardless of the side.
      Parameters:
      side - the side of the wanted piece
      type - the type of the wanted piece
      Returns:
      the piece corresponding to the given combination of side and type

    • fromFenSymbol

      public static Piece fromFenSymbol(String fenSymbol)
      Returns the piece corresponding to the given Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) symbol.
      Parameters:
      fenSymbol - a piece FEN symbol, such as K, b or p
      Returns:
      the piece that corresponds to the FEN symbol provided in input
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the input symbol does not correspond to any standard chess piece

    • getSanSymbol

      public String getSanSymbol()
      Returns the Short Algebraic Notation (SAN) symbol for this piece. For example, R for a rook, K for a king, or an empty string for a pawn.
      Returns:
      the SAN symbol of this piece

    • getFanSymbol

      public String getFanSymbol()
      Returns the Figurine Algebraic Notation (FAN) symbol for this piece. For example, ♜ for a black rook, or ♙ for a white pawn.
      Returns:
      the FAN symbol of this piece

    • getFenSymbol

      public String getFenSymbol()
      Returns the Forsyth-Edwards Notation (FEN) symbol for this piece. For example, r for a black rook, or P for a white pawn.
      Returns:
      the FEN symbol of this piece
